March 29 at 10:31 AM ¬∑

While schools are closed, first responders, healthcare workers and others providing critical services to Larimer County during the COVID-19 pandemic cannot choose between going to work and staying home with their families. Their service keeps us all safe and healthy, so we have stepped up to give them a place to send their kids while they fight on the frontlines of this pandemic. With tremendous support from the Larimer County Health Department, Banner Health and many other community partners, we are operating two sites for youth ages 5-13 whose parents or guardians are first responders, healthcare workers and others providing critical services‚Äîone in Loveland, one in Fort Collins. We are following all official guidelines, including proper sanitizing and social distancing. To keep everyone safe and healthy, these sites are ONLY for the kids of first responders, healthcare professionals and others providing critical services.

Applications must be postmarked TODAY!
Loveland Philo is preparing to award scholarships for the 2020-2021 academic year. The scholarships support prospective and continuing students who live within Loveland and Berthoud, seeking a 2-year vocational/technical education or certificate program. The applicants must demonstrate financial need, have intentions of seeking training, and are strongly motivated to earn their associated degree or certificate.

The annual Philo Golf Tournament funds the scholarships with more than $170,000 in financial support awarded to applicants in past years!

"Philo," short for Philomatheon Club, is one of the oldest service clubs in Loveland. Founded in 1918 by high school students, the club was organized as a way for young women to come together in friendship and service to the community. Today, 100 years later, these goals remain. Beginning as a small group of 10, the club has continuously grown over the years.
